      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>

          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Echolocation process in bats</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Echolocation Prozeß in den Hieben</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Processus d'Echolocation dans les battes</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Processo de Echolocation nos bastões</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Processo di Echolocation in blocchi</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Διαδικασία Echolocation στα ρόπαλα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Proceso de Echolocation en palos</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows a bat producing a sound and listening to the echo made when sound reflects off  walls and other objects. This technique which helps them find their way in the dark is called echolocation</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">amplitude</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">bat</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">echolocation</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Hearing</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">loudness</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">reflection</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">sound</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">vibrations</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt einen Hieb, einen Ton 
produzierend und zum gebildeten Echo hörend, wenn Ton weg weg den 
Wänden und von anderen Nachrichten sich reflektiert. Diese 
Technik, die ihnen hilft, ihre Methode in der Dunkelheit zu finden, 
wird echolocation genannt</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre une batte produisant un
bruit et écoutant l'écho fait quand le bruit se reflète outre des 
murs et d'autres objets. Cette technique qui les aide à trouver
leur chemin dans l'obscurité s'appelle l'echolocation</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra um bastão produzindo um
som e escutando o eco feito quando o som reflete fora das paredes e 
dos outros objetos. Esta técnica que lhes ajuda encontrar sua 
maneira na obscuridade é chamada echolocation</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra un blocco producendo 
un suono ed ascoltando l'eco fatto quando il suono riflette fuori 
delle pareti e di altri oggetti. Questa tecnica che li aiuta a 
trovare il loro modo nell'oscurità è chiamata echolocation</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει ένα ρόπαλο παράγοντας 
έναν ήχο και το άκουσμα την ηχώ έκανε όταν απεικονίζει ο ήχος 
από τους τοίχους και άλλα αντικείμενα. Αυτή η τεχνική που 
τους βοηθά να βρούν τον τρόπο τους στο σκοτάδι καλείται 
echolocation</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra un palo produciendo un 
sonido y escuchando la generación de eco hecha cuando el sonido 
refleja de las paredes y de otros objetos. Esta técnica que les
ayuda a encontrar su manera en la obscuridad se llama echolocation</string>
          </description>
